name: First Federal Savings & Loan Association of Boston v. Tax Commission of Massachusetts
United States v. New York Telephone Company
Cleland v. National College of Business
Crist, et al. v. Cline & Brest
J. W. Bateson Company, Inc. v. United States ex rel. Board of Trustees of National Automatic Sprinkler Industry Pension Fund
Stump v. Sparkman
question: Does a district court judge have the power to entertain and act upon the petition for sterilization, which makes him immune from damages liability even if his approval of the petition was in error?
description: A case in which the Court held that a district court judge has the power to entertain and act upon the petition for sterilization, which makes him immune from damages liability even if his approval of the petition was in error.

name: First National Bank of Boston v. Bellotti
question: Does the First Amendment protect the rights of corporations to attempt to influence the outcome of elections in which they have no direct monetary interest?

name: Owen Equipment & Erection Company v. Kroger
In re Primus
question: Can a state punish an attorney who advises someone of her legal rights and discloses that free legal assistance is available from a non-profit organization with which the attorney is affiliated?
description: A case in which the Court held that a state cannot punish an attorney who advises someone of her legal rights and discloses that free legal assistance is available from a non-profit organization with which the attorney is affiliated.

name: Mincey v. Arizona
question:
1. Did the admission of evidence taken during a four-day long warrantless search of Mincey’s residence constitute an unreasonable search or seizure under the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments?

2. Did the admission of Mincey’s responses to police questioning made while he was a patient in the intensive care unit of a hospital violate his privilege against self-incrimination, rights to counsel and due process under the Fifth, Sixth, and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Andrus v. Charlestone Stone Products Company
Zenith Radio Corporation v. United States
Zablocki v. Redhail
question: Did the Wisconsin statute violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Christiansburg Garment Company v. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
Hicklin v. Orbeck
question: Did the Alaska statute violate the Constitution's Privileges and Immunities Clause of Article IV, Section 2, and the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Bordenkircher v. Hayes
question: Does the Fourteenth Amendment's Due Process Clause prohibit state prosecutors from carrying out a threat made during plea negotiations to re-indict the accused on more serious charges if he does not plead guilty to the offense with which he was originally charged?

name: Monell v. Department of Social Services of the City of New York
question: If sued in their official capacity, are local government officials and organizations such as a school board considered “persons” for the purpose of liability for back wages?

name: Pennsylvania v. Mimms
question: Do police officers violate the Fourth Amendment's prohibition against unlawful searches and seizures when, during a routine traffic stop, they obtain evidence through a search conducted after asking the suspect to exit the vehicle without a justifiable reason to do so?

name: Carey v. Piphus
question: In cases dealing with the denial of due process, must a plaintiff prove that he was actually injured by the deprivation in order to recover substantial nonpunitive damages?

name: Landmark Communications, Inc. v. Virginia
question: Did the criminal punishment of Landmark for disclosing information from the Judicial Inquiry and Review Commission's hearing violate the First Amendment?

name: National Society of Professional Engineers v. United States
United States v. United States Gypsum Company
Citizens & Southern Nat. Bank v. Bougas
American Broadcasting Companies, Inc. v. Writers Guild of America, West, Inc.
question: Does a labor union violate the National Labor Relations Act when it disciplines its members for crossing the picket line to perform collective-bargaining and grievance-adjustment tasks during a strike?
description: A case in which the Court held that a labor union violated the National Labor Relations Act when it disciplined its members for crossing the picket line to perform collective-bargaining and grievance-adjustment tasks during a strike.

name: United States v. LaSalle National Bank
Southern Overlying Carrier Chapter of the California Dump Truck Owners Association v. Public Utilities Commission of California
Michigan v. Tyler
question: Does the Fourth Amendment protection against illegal searches and seizures extend to investigations of burned premises for evidence of arson?

name: Butz v. Economou
question: Are federal administrators entitled to absolute or qualified immunity in the face of challenges to their conduct of public business?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Local Union No. 103, International Association of Bridge, Structural & Ornamental Iron Workers, AFL-CIO
Exxon Corporation v. Governor of Maryland
question:
(1) Does Maryland's statute violate the Due Process and Commerce Clauses of the Constitution?

(2) Does Maryland's statute conflict with the Robinson-Patman Act?

name: Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corporation v. Natural Resources Defense Council, Inc.
Foley v. Connelie
question: Did the New York law violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: National Broiler Marketing Assn. v. United States
Ballew v. Georgia
question: Does a state criminal trial by a jury of only five persons deprive the accused of the right to a trial by jury as protected by the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: United Air Lines, Inc. v. McMann
Tennessee Valley Authority v. Hill
question:
(1) Does the ESA prohibit completion of the Tellico Dam?

(2) Is the Snail Darter protected by the Endangered Species Act, even though congress continued to fund the dam project and stated that it should be completed?

name: Eastex, Inc. v. National Labor Relations Board
Massachusetts v. United States
question: Did the tax on civil aircraft violate the implied immunity of state governments from federal taxation?

name: Board of Curators of the University of Missouri v. Horowitz
question: Does an academic dismissal from a university without a hearing before the school’s decision-making body violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that an academic dismissal from a university without a hearing before the school’s decision-making body did not violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Pfizer Inc. v. Government of India
Lockett v. Ohio
question: Did the Ohio law violate the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments by limiting the consideration of mitigating factors?

name: Penn Central Transportation Company v. New York City
question: Did the restriction against Penn Central constitute a "taking" in violation of the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Beth Israel Hospital v. National Labor Relations Board
question: Was the U.S. Court of Appeals for the First Circuit correct in upholding the part of the National Labor Relations Board's order that barred the hospital from enforcing its rule that prohibited employees from distributing union literature and soliciting support in eating facilities?

name: Hutto v. Finney
question: Did punitive isolation for more than thirty days in the Arkansas prison system constitute cruel and unusual punishment as prohibited by the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Federal Communications Commission v. National Citizens Committee for Broadcasting
Browder v. Director, Dept. of Corrections of Ill.
Baldwin v. Fish and Game Commission of Montana
question: Did the Montana law violate the Privileges and Immunities Clause of the Constitution as delineated in Article IV, Section 2?

name: Parker v. Flook
question: Does the identification of a limited category of useful applications of a mathematical formula, such as its use in catalytic conversion processes, render a method based on such a formula-eligible for patent protection?
description: A case in which the Court held that, absent some other novel or inventive concept in the individual’s application for a patent, activity that results from the solution of a formula or algorithm cannot transform the formula from an unpatentable principle into a patentable process.

name: McDaniel v. Paty
question: Does the Tennessee statute barring “Minister[s] of the Gospel or priest[s] of any denomination whatever” from serving as legislators violate the free exercise of religion guaranteed through the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Richmond Unified School District v. Berg
United States v. California
question: Does California have jurisdiction over the submerged lands and waters under the Submerged Lands Act of 1953?

name: Zurcher v. Stanford Daily
question: Did the search of The Daily's newsroom violate the First and Fourth Amendments?

name: Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Kowalski
United States v. Jacobs
question: If a witness in a trial is a potential defendant, should the individual be warned of their constitutionally-protected rights against self-incrimination?
description: A case in which the Court declined to answer the question of whether, if a witness in a trial is a potential defendant, the individual should be warned of their constitutionally-protected rights against self-incrimination.

name: Adamo Wrecking Company v. United States
Duke Power Company v. Carolina Environmental Study Group, Inc.
Memphis Light, Gas & Water Division v. Craft
Sears, Roebuck & Company v. San Diego County District Council of Carpenters
Greyhound Corporation v. Mt. Hood Stages, Inc.
Federal Communications Commission v. Pacifica Foundation
question: Does the First Amendment deny government any power to restrict the public broadcast of indecent language under any circumstances?
description: A case in which the Court held that audience, medium, time of day and method of transmission were all relevant factors in determining what speech is protected by the First Amendment.

name: Department of Revenue of Washington v. Association of Washington Stevedoring Companies
Kulko v. Superior Court of Cal., City and County of San Francisco
Houchins v. KQED Inc.
question: Did the First Amendment guarantee news media a right of access to jails over and above that of other persons?

name: Will v. Calvert Fire Insurance Company
Flagg Bros., Inc. v. Brooks
question: Does a New York state statute that allows storage companies to sell stored goods if they do not receive payment violate the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Allied Structural Steel Company v. Spannaus
question: Did Minnesota's Private Pension Benefits Protection Act violate the Contract Clause of the Constitution?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Robbins Tire & Rubber Company
St. Paul Fire & Marine Insurance Company v. Barry
City of Philadelphia v. New Jersey
question: Did New Jersey's waste importation law violate the Commerce Clause?

name: United States Steel Corporation v. Multistate Tax Commission
question: Did the formation of this group violate the the Compact Clause of Article I?

name: Idaho Department of Employment v. Smith
Holloway v. Arkansas
question: Does requiring a single attorney to represent multiple defendants deprive the defendants of their Sixth Amendment right to adequate assistance of counsel?

name: Federal Maritime Commission v. Pacific Maritime Assn
United States v. Board of Commissioners of Sheffield, Alabama
Raymond Motor Transportation, Inc. v. Rice
Frank Lyon Company v. United States
City of Lafayette v. Louisiana Power & Light Company
Central Illinois Public Service Company v. United States
County Bd. of Arlington County, Virginia v. Richards
Chase Manhattan Bank (National Association) v. South Acres Development Company
City of Los Angeles Department of Water and Power v. Manhart
question:
Does a policy that requires women to make larger contributions to a company’s pension plan than men because women tend to live longer violate the Civil Rights Act of 1964?

Is the company liable for the amount of the excess payment?

name: Securities and Exchange Commission v. Sloan
Ohralik v. Ohio State Bar Assn.
question: Do professional ethics rules for the legal profession that ban in-person solicitation of non-lawyers violate free speech guarantees under the First and Fourteenth Amendments?
description: A case in which the Court held that a state may constitutionally discipline a lawyer for soliciting clients in person and for financial gain under circumstances likely to pose dangers that the state has a right to prevent.

name: Agosto v. Immigration and Naturalization Service
